name: The Gates Scholarship
description: A highly selective, full scholarship for exceptional, Pell-eligible, minority, high school seniors.

name: Jack Kent Cooke Foundation College Scholarship
description: Provides scholarships to high-achieving high school seniors with financial need.

name: Amazon Future Engineer Scholarship
description: For students pursuing a computer science degree with financial need.

name: Dell Scholars Program
description: Supports low-income, highly motivated students in achieving a college degree.

name: LinkedIn Possibilities in Tech
description: Supports underrepresented highly motivated students in achieving a college degree pursuing a degree in Computer Science(and adjacent fields)
link: Link will be added when it comes out

name: Coca Cola Scholarship
description: Supports highly motivated students in their pursuit of college
link: Link will be added when it comes out

name: Ron Brown Scholarship
description: A prestigious scholarship honoring the legacy of Ronald H. Brown, supporting academically talented and service-minded African American high school seniors with financial need. The program emphasizes leadership, community engagement, and public service.

name: Jackie Robinson
description: The Jackie Robinson Foundation Scholarship awards up to $35,000 over four years to outstanding minority high school seniors who demonstrate academic excellence, leadership, and financial need

name: Hagan Scholarship
description: The Hagan Scholarship is a nationwide need-based merit scholarship that provides up to $48,000 over four years to high-achieving, low-income high school seniors from rural areas to attend college and graduate debt-free.
eligibility: must work 240 hours in the 12 months prior to fall college enrollment
must attend an eligible public high school
amount: $48,000 over 4 years + study abroad and graduate school funding

name: Cameron Impact Scholarship
description: The Cameron Impact Scholarship is a four-year, full-tuition, merit-based scholarship awarded to high school seniors who have demonstrated excellence in academics, leadership, extracurricular activities, and community service.
eligibility: planning to attend a full-time U.S. college or university
amount: Full tuition and fees for 4 years
